channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China Is Investigating Google Over Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Google’s limited presence in China gives Beijing room to hit back harder if President Donald Trump’s trade war escalates.

item.title: Amazon continues renewable energy spree with 476 MW purchase
item.description: Amazon’s power bill has been soaring lately as it adds data centers to deal with rising demand for AI and cloud services. © 2024 TechCrunch. All right...

item.title: 10 Best Gifts for Women Who Are Over This Planet (2025)
item.description: She’s seen enough. She’s had enough. She can’t book a one-way ticket to the stars (yet), but these gifts will help her transcend this world.

item.title: E-fuels startup will make diamonds before powering jet planes
item.description: Circularity’s process uses 40% less energy than competing CO2-to-fuel pathways. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Federal Workers Sue to Disconnect DOGE Server
item.description: Two federal workers, citing reports that Elon Musk’s associates are operating an illegally connected email server at OPM, seek a restraining order.

item.title: Challenging Bluesky, Threads now allows for public custom feeds
item.description: Meta’s Threads is doubling down on support for custom feeds as it faces challenges from the growing social network Bluesky, now with over 30 million u...

item.title: TED Talks has put out an all-call for a new leader
item.description: Chris Anderson, who has run TED for 25 years, is looking to bestow the operation on anyone who has a good plan for its future, he announced in a blog ...

item.title: Trump's Plan to Make European Cars More Expensive Has a Fatal Flaw
item.description: President Trump's threat of 25 percent tariffs on EU car imports could spark an automotive trade war—one that will result in higher prices for all and...

item.title: A review of Tapestry, an app powered by the growing open web
item.description: A new app called Tapestry, which launched Tuesday, aggregates and organizes information from across the web and social networks in a single place. It ...

item.title: Chris Anderson Is Giving TED Away to Whoever Has the Best Idea for Its Future
item.description: In an exclusive interview with WIRED, the British entrepreneur shares why it’s time to move on from TED.
